description: SecureRandom is known to have vulnerabilities in some versions of Java and it's not recommended to use it for generating random numbers or secrets.
recommendation: Use a cryptographically secure random number generator, like java.security.SecureRandom.

vulnerable_code: long l = sr.nextLong(); sr.setSeed(l); int v = sr.nextInt();
description: When a random number generator is seeded with a random number, it may create predictable sequences. This can be dangerous in security-sensitive applications.
recommendation: Use a secure way of seeding the random number generator, like using java.security.SecureRandom to provide a seed.
